docs.title: About
docs.text: Synthesize aims to deliver high quality products to all our users while putting saftey as our #1 priority

docs.title: Locksy
docs.text:
Locksy serves as the core symbol of what we aim to achive at synthesize. It bundles great features and child saftety tools into one package.

Read More

docs.title: Basic Commands
docs.text: These are commands for all users to use

docs.title: Verify
docs.text:
Starts the verification process to connect your account 

/verify (method) (roblox-username)

Methods:

  • OATH - Connect your account via the roblox OATH system
  • BIO - Connect your account by placing a string of words in your bio

roblox-username is only required for the BIO verifcation method

docs.title: Profile
docs.text:
Gets your current stats for this group 

/profile

docs.title: Officer Commands
docs.text: These are commands that can only be used by officers in your group

docs.title: Kick
docs.text:
Kicks a user from your server 

/kick (user) (reason)

docs.title: Ban
docs.text:
Banss a user from your server and all your roblox games if they are verified 

/ban (user) (duration) (reason)

docs.title: Mute
docs.text:
Mutes a user in your server and all your roblox games if they are verified 

/mute (user) (duration) (reason)

docs.title: Owner Commands
docs.text: These are commands only the community owner can use

docs.title: Setup
docs.text:
Sets up your server for your main roblox group 

/setup (groupid)

docs.title: API_KEY
docs.text:
This key is given to you when setting up the bot. You can either store the key as plain text here or as a secret

Plain TextRoblox Secret 
API_KEY = "EXAMPLEKEY_1234567";

API_KEY = game:GetService("HttpService"):GetSecret("API_KEY");

docs.title: PROFILE_SERVICE
docs.text:
If you are currently using profile service, put its path here

DefaultPath Provided

Locksy will generate its own profile service instance

PROFILE_SERVICE = nil;

Use this if you already have a ProfileService handeler running

PROFILE_SERVICE = game:GetService("ServerScriptService").ProfileHandeler;

Your custom ProfileHandeler must contain the following method

module.GetProfile = function(player :Player) :table
    return *THE PLAYERS PROFILE*
end

docs.title: ENFORCE_BAN_LIST
docs.text:
When a player who is on our list of known predators and bad actors joins your game should it kick them

EnabledDisabled 
ENFORCE_BAN_LIST = true;

ENFORCE_BAN_LIST = false;

docs.title: ERP_API_KEY
docs.text:
If you get approved for an API_KEY from Ruben Sim's erpsearcher you can put it here and we will handle kicking them

No KeyAPI Key 
ERP_API_KEY = nil;

ERP_API_KEY = "SEARCHER_example1234567example1234567";

docs.title: WEBHOOK
docs.text:
Place your webhook here for all moderation actions to be logged

EnabledDisabled 
WEBHOOK = "https://discord.com/api/webhooks/1234567890/example1234567_example1234567890";

WEBHOOK = "";

docs.title: LocksyTier
docs.text: type LocksyTier = "FREE" | "PAID"

docs.title: PossibleAddons
docs.text:
Describes what addons are available 

type PossibleAddons = "MEDALS AND QUALIFICATIONS" | "CUSTOM UNIFORMS" | "FACTIONS"

docs.title: Info_Return
docs.text:
type Info_Return = {
    Status: boolean,                --Did it work?
    GroupName: string,              --Name of the group
    GroupID: number,                --ID of the group
    VerifiedMembers: number,        --How many members from your group in the system
    LocksyTier: LocksyTier,         --What tier are you running
    LocksyAddons: {PossibleAddons}, --List of all active addons
}

docs.title: XP_Return
docs.text:
type XP_Return = {
    Status: boolean,        --Successfull?
    XP_Val: number,         --Users new XP value (-1 if error)
    Last_Updated: number    --UNIX Timestamp (-1 if error)
}

docs.title: Functions
docs.text: The main LOCKSY module script contains all the function you will ever need to call. They are all described below.

docs.title: GetInfo
docs.text:
Gets information about this groups running Locksy instance 

Locksy.GetInfo() :Info_Return

docs.title: GetUserXP
docs.text:
Gets a users XP value 

Locksy.GetUserXP(userid :number) :XP_Return

docs.title: SetUserXP
docs.text:
Sets a users XP value to the given value 

Locksy.SetUserXP(userid :number, value :number) :XP_Return

docs.title: UpdateUserXP
docs.text:
Changes a users XP value by the ammount 

Locksy.UpdateUserXP(userid :number, ammount :number) :XP_Return

docs.title: About
docs.text:
Locksy aims to provide user saftey and easily allow the linking of roblox games and groups with discord servers. You can see all features listed below by tier / addon

Free Tier1

  • Roblox Verification
  • Kick/Ban/Mute Mod Discord Commands
  • Blacklist groups
  • Auto kick known predators and bad actors on discord and roblox
  • Message logging on discord and roblox
  • Banned words filter on discord and roblox
  • Join/Leave logging on discord and roblox

Premium Tier

  • Auto Updating Rank binds on discord
  • XP System, auto promotes members at XP milestones
  • Quota Tracking

Add Ons

  • Custom Uniforms
    • /setuniform Discord command
    • Integration into roblox lockers
  • Factions
    • Users make factions through the bot (with owner set criteria)
    • Factions display and can be modified from in-game
    • Faction Owners can add Locksy to their server and use it to manage their faction
  • Medals and Qualifications
    • /givemedal and /qualify Discord commands
    • Data is available for uniform makers and in-game

docs.title: Setup
docs.text:
1. Read the Terms of Service & Privacy Policy
  2. Add the Locksy bot to your main discord server
  3. Add the Locksy model to your roblox game under game.ServerScriptService
  4. Run the /setup command in your discord server
  5. Add your API_KEY to the LOCKSY module that you imported

  1. A green check indicates an added feature, a grey check indicates a beta or work-in-progress feature ↩

docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs
docs.text: For full documentation visit mkdocs.org.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Flowcharts
docs.text:
graph LR
  A[Start] --> B{Failure?};
  B -->|Yes| C[Investigate...];
  C --> D[Debug];
  D --> B;
  B ---->|No| E[Success!];
